intro: Lasia roxburghii, commonly known as the Himalayan lasia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
